title: How to Drive in Kingdom of Saudi Arabia

steps.title: Drive on the right side of the road.
steps.content: Drive on the right side of the road. The steering wheel is on the left side like in the US and most countries. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Get a license.
steps.content: Get a license. You will need to pass a reverse or parallel parking test. [2] X Research source It doesn't matter which type of car you get, manual or automatic transmission.

steps.title: Don't drive over the speed limit.
steps.content: Don't drive over the speed limit. Although very common, it is being enforced; there are cops with speed cameras almost everywhere. Undercover cops are also very common on highways, usually a white lumina, crown Victoria, or corolla with flashers hid behind the tinted glass, and sometimes they have police bumpers.

steps.title: Drive in the extreme right lane if you are traveling slower than other traffic; be alert for traffic exiting and entering the road, particularly if the right side is not curbed.
steps.content: Drive in the extreme right lane if you are traveling slower than other traffic; be alert for traffic exiting and entering the road, particularly if the right side is not curbed. Pass on the left.

steps.title: Use turn signal/indicators in the direction you want to go when changing lanes, turning, and waiting at signals, etc.
steps.content: Use turn signal/indicators in the direction you want to go when changing lanes, turning, and waiting at signals, etc.

steps.title: Be cautious if you are a woman.
steps.content: Be cautious if you are a woman. As of June 2018, it is no longer illegal for women to drive in Saudi Arabia. [3] X Research source However, it's entirely possible that a woman driving may be met with negative reactions from men. Take caution not to break any driving laws, so as to avoid drawing the attention of an ill-mannered policeman.
